Job Details

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Intelligence Lead specializing in PowerBI to join our team in the Healthcare industry. This is a unique opportunity for a motivated individual to play a pivotal role in transforming our business operations by leveraging data and analytics. The Business Intelligence Lead will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our business intelligence capabilities. This role requires a deep understanding of data management (e.g., permissions, recovery, security, monitoring), data warehousing, report writing, and delivering business intelligence insights to the team.

Responsibilities


 * Lead the development and execution of the company's business intelligence strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
 * Design, develop, and implement business intelligence dashboards and reports using PowerBI to provide insights and support decision-making processes.
 * Manage the full lifecycle of BI projects, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
 * Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
 * Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
 * Evaluate and preprocess raw information to ensure accuracy and reliability.
 * Use SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API to manage and manipulate data, including data extraction, storage, transformation, and loading.
 * Maintain and ensure data privacy and compliance according to industry standards and regulations.
 * Conduct training sessions to educate end-users on the utilization of BI tools and dashboards.
 * Stay current with industry trends and developments in BI and healthcare to ensure the company's BI capabilities are cutting-edge.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in a business intelligence role, preferably in the healthcare industry.
 * Proven experience with BI technologies, specifically PowerBI.
 * Strong knowledge of SQL, SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API.
 * Experience in data warehouse design and data mining.
 * Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution, etc.)
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
 * Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations related to data privacy and management.
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
   
   

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business results and have a proven track record in business intelligence, we would love to hear from you. Join us and help shape the future of our organization with your expertise.

description:
Job Title: Data Strategy Head

Location: Cambridge, MA (Hybrid)

50% Remote working and up to 10% of travel expected.

About The Job

We deliver 4.3 billion healthcare solutions to people every year, thanks to the flawless planning and meticulous eye for detail of our Manufacturing & Supply teams. With your talent and ambition, we can do even more to protect people from infectious diseases and bring hope to patients and their families.

The fundamental role of Operational Excellence & Digital is to:


 * Design, deploy and continuously improve our “best in class” operating standards across EM&S teams : Simplify, Standardize and Digitize.
 * Stimulate performance improvement across the network by:
   
   

Setting the vision of “Smart CMO” and the design/deployment of specific roadmaps leveraging disruptive technologies, digital & innovative training practices

Framing the Strategic Performance Ambition while being a consistent “service provider” when deviating from targeted trajectory


 * Reinforce and expand Culture of Excellence through specific programs, trainings and best practices sharing.
   
   

Operational Excellence & Digital plays an important role to support External Manufacturing & Supply (EM&S) to become a “best in class/first in class” organization.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. We’re also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started?

Main Responsibilities

As External Manufacturing Data Strategy Senior Leader, you will be playing an important role to drive and accelerate our data and digital deployment across External Manufacturing & Supply organization, as key pillar of the modernization of our organization towards faster and more efficient decision making, process standardization to deliver best-in-class performance.


 * Lead the next steps of EM&S digital evolution by accelerating deployment of EM&S data foundation leveraging on Corporate Snowflake data-lake as well as the deployment of Advanced Analytics and AI capabilities across the full EM&S organization.
 * Propose and drive EM&S Data Strategy to support next steps of EM&S growths (size, complexity and performance)
 * Partner with our Digital group to ensure fast deployment of EM&S data foundation into Snowflake solution according to business needs.
 * Build all data views and tables in Snowflake to support operational teams and answer to their needs in terms of reporting and analytics.
 * Work closely with project team on collaborative platform with CMOs to integrate and expend data into our Data Foundation.
 * Support operational teams in developing real time CMO performance management tools and monitoring across organization.
 * Drive fast and insightful decision-making within the organization, leveraging on AI/Plai technological platform and on complex data sets. You will lead and engage EM&S teams to propose/develop correlations between different data sets in order to accelerate predictive solutions deployment to become best-in-class External Manufacturing organization.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities and deploy data-driven solutions to address key challenges.
 * Design and implement predictive models, working in close collaboration with Digital and Plai/aily labs teams, to optimize business processes and enhance CMO & virtual sites performance metrics.
 * Interpret findings from data analysis and communicate actionable insights to stakeholders at all levels of the organization through compelling visualizations and presentations.
   
   

About You


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field.
 * Proven experience (10 years or more) working as a data scientist preferably in similar international business industry (pharmaceutical would be a plus).
 * Previous experience working with Snowflake is required.
 * Advanced knowledge and experience on AI technology and machine learning implementation projects.
 * Effective communication and stakeholder management.
 * Project management and cross-functional collaboration.
 * Languages: English
   
   

Why Choose Us?


 * Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
 * Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
 * Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.
 * Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.
   
   

Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Strategy Head

description:
Are you passionate about ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and reliability? Do you have a meticulous eye for detail and a talent for identifying data discrepancies? If you’re ready to take on the challenge of safeguarding data quality, our client has the ideal role for you. We’re looking for a Data Quality Analyst (aka The Data Integrity Champion) to monitor, validate, and improve data across the organization, ensuring that our data assets are trustworthy and ready for strategic use.

As a Data Quality Analyst at our client, you’ll work with data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to develop and maintain data quality standards. Your role will be critical in ensuring that data used for reporting, analytics, and decision-making is accurate, complete, and timely.

Key Responsibilities Perform Data Validation and Cleansing: Conduct Root Cause Analysis on Data Issues: Collaborate on Data Governance Initiatives: Develop and Run Data Quality Reports: Provide Training and Support on Data Quality Best Practices: Monitor and Optimize Data Quality Tools and Processes:


 * Establish and Maintain Data Quality Standards:
 * Define data quality metrics, standards, and KPIs to assess data health. You’ll implement frameworks to monitor and maintain data accuracy, consistency, completeness, and reliability.
 * Develop processes to validate and cleanse data from various sources, identifying and correcting errors or inconsistencies. You’ll work with data engineering teams to automate data validation and improve data integrity.
 * Investigate and resolve data quality issues by performing root cause analysis. You’ll recommend solutions to prevent data errors and work with teams to implement preventive measures.
 * Partner with data governance and compliance teams to establish data policies and standards. You’ll ensure that data quality processes align with regulatory requirements and internal standards.
 * Create reports that assess data quality across datasets, highlighting trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement. You’ll provide actionable insights to stakeholders to enhance data quality.
 * Educate teams on data quality best practices and promote a culture of data stewardship. You’ll develop training materials and conduct workshops to empower data users.
 * Use and optimize data quality tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Trifacta) to streamline data quality checks and validations. You’ll keep up-to-date with new tools and techniques to improve data quality processes.
   
   

Required Skills


 * Data Quality Expertise: Strong knowledge of data quality principles, methodologies, and metrics. You can define and track KPIs for data health and integrity.
 * Analytical Skills and Root Cause Analysis: Proficiency in conducting root cause analysis and implementing solutions to resolve data issues. You have a proactive approach to identifying and correcting data discrepancies.
 * Data Profiling and Validation: Experience with data profiling, validation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
 * Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL for querying and analyzing data, along with familiarity with data quality tools like Informatica, Talend, or Trifacta.
 * Communication and Collaboration: Ability to communicate complex data quality issues in a clear and actionable manner. You can work effectively with cross-functional teams to implement quality improvements.
   
   

Educational Requirements


 * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Information Management, Computer Science, or a related field. Equivalent experience in data quality management or data analysis may be considered.
 * Certifications in data quality or data management (e.g., Certified Information Management Professional, Informatica Data Quality) are advantageous.
   
   

Experience Requirements


 * 3+ years of experience in data quality analysis, with a proven track record of improving data quality across various systems.
 * Experience with data governance frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
 * Familiarity with data warehousing and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
   
   

Benefits


 * Health and Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with low co-pays and premiums.
 * Paid Time Off: Competitive vacation, sick leave, and 20 paid holidays per year.
 * Work-Life Balance: Flexible work schedules and telecommuting options.
 * Professional Development: Opportunities for training, certification reimbursement, and career advancement programs.
 * Wellness Programs: Access to wellness programs, including gym memberships, health screenings, and mental health resources.
 * Life and Disability Insurance: Life insurance and short-term/long-term disability coverage.
 * Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Confidential counseling and support services for personal and professional challenges.
 * Tuition Reimbursement: Financial assistance for continuing education and professional development.
 * Community Engagement: Opportunities to participate in community service and volunteer activities.
 * Recognition Programs: Employee recognition programs to celebrate achievements and milestones.

title: Data Engineer - Hybrid

description:
This is a hybrid role.  The first three months are fulltime in the office. 



As a member of Eversource’s Advanced Modeling and Forecasting team, you will help to influence, to shape, and to optimize billions of dollars of grid investments over the next decade, ensuring our safe and effective transition into a clean energy future while providing highest standards of reliability and resiliency. The team strives for "best in class" data, analytics, and application practices, to help Eversource build the most advanced Distributed Energy Resources (DER) forecasting in the nation from the ground up.



As a Data Scientist, you will specialize in Distributed Energy Resources (DER) forecasting and power system impacts with a focus on emerging technologies (PV, EV, heat pumps). You will work with cross-functional teams to develop and implement advanced forecasting methodologies. By building a best-in-class electric distribution system analytics hub for actionable insights, you will drive strategic decision-making; around capital infrastructure investments, regulatory and rate case engagements, reliability and resiliency investments, and more. Your team members are other data scientists and engineers who develop forecast models for electric vehicles, heat pumps and other new load and generation resources to inform Eversource’s capital investments.




Essential Functions:

 * 
   Develop, use, maintain and manage models and solutions for forecasting long term load, solar and storage, building and transportation electrification
   
 * 
   Collect, preprocess, and analyze historical load and generation data to calibrate and validate forecasting models, ensuring accuracy and reliability across different DERs
   
 * 
   Monitor and evaluate performance of forecasting models and identify inconsistencies and improvements
   
 * 
   Conduct research and stay abreast of developments in emerging technologies, regulatory policies and best practices for modeling energy demand and generation
   
 * 
   Collaborate with cross functional teams, including engineers, data scientists, analysts, and energy efficiency experts to integrate advanced forecasting into system planning and operations
   
 * 
   Provide technical expertise and support internal stakeholders, external partners and customers on DER forecasting, power systems analysis, and renewable energy integration
   
 * 
   Clearly document advanced forecasting efforts and work with other departments to integrate new and existing processes
   
   
   
   
   
   

Technical Knowledge/Skill/Education/Licenses/Certifications:



Technical Knowledge/Skill: 

 * 
   Experience in forecasting with a focus on energy demand and DER applications
   
 * 
   Proficient programming skills in one or more languages (e.g. Python, Spark, SQL)
   
 * 
   Cloud architecture and tools, such as Microsoft Azure and Databricks
   
 * 
   Familiar with predictive analytics and statistical modeling techniques in the context of power systems, load forecasting, and renewable energy
   
 * 
   Familiar with distribution engineering and system planning processes
   
 * 
   Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work in a cross-functional environment
   
 * 
   Problem solving skills to analyze complex engineering data and draw actionable insights
   
   
   
   
   

Education:  

 * 
   BS in Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or related quantitative field.
   
 * 
   Masters preferred.
   
   
   
   
   

Experience:

 * 
   3+ years of related experience as a data scientist. Advanced/additional degrees will require fewer years of experience.
   
   
   
   
   

The ideal candidate will have experience with:                     

 * 
   Experience working with time series data, PI SCADA systems, DER management platforms and/or AMI (Advanced Metering Infrastructure)
   
 * 
   Geospatial tools, data and models (e.g. ArcGIS, Google Earth)
   
 * 
   Knowledge of regulatory frameworks, grid integration considerations related to DERs
   
 * 
   Experience in power systems engineering, energy modeling, or related fields
   
   
   
   
   
   

Compensation and Benefits:

Eversource offers a competitive total rewards program.  The annual salary range for this position is $94,940.00 to $105,490.00, plus incentive.  Salary is commensurate with your experience.  Check out the career site for an overview of our benefits. 




Working Conditions:

 * 
   Must be available to work emergency restoration assignment as required.
   
 * 
   Must be available to travel between MA/CT/NH as necessary.

title: Data Scientist (Hybrid)

description:
Job Overview

We are in search of a Senior SQL Data Engineer to join our innovative team, based in Jacksonville, FL. This hybrid position combines the benefits of onsite collaboration with the flexibility of remote work, offering an outstanding opportunity to engage in transformative projects within a nurturing and growth-oriented environment.

Key Responsibilities

In this critical role as a Senior SQL Data Engineer, you will:


 * Develop and implement coding solutions using Python for enterprise-level applications.
 * Maintain comprehensive system documentation, conduct unit testing, and facilitate peer code reviews.
 * Assess, test, and integrate third-party products effectively.
 * Establish IT controls to protect application data and ensure system integrity.
 * Design and construct RESTful APIs with Python, geared towards scalable and reliable system architecture.
 * Manage batch files, optimizing and scheduling batch processes as needed.
 * Collaborate with your team to explore libraries and technologies that fulfill both technical and business objectives.
 * Engage with diverse databases, including SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, PostgreSQL, and Cassandra.
   
   

Required Skills

To excel in this position, you should possess:


 * Proficient knowledge of SQL scripting, querying, and advanced database management.
 * Expertise in Python programming, particularly in building REST APIs and managing batch file processes.
 * Experience in UNIX/Linux shell scripting and familiarity with Hadoop environments.
 * Knowledge of PySpark and capability in handling large datasets (millions of records).
 * A comprehensive understanding of the systems development lifecycle, along with experience in unit testing, release management, and change control processes.
 * A systematic approach towards evaluating and implementing new technologies to meet the organization's needs.
 * Strong analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills to ensure effective teamwork.
   
   

Qualifications


 * A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent professional experience.
 * A minimum of 5 years of experience in technical design and programming within the IT sector.
 * Proven hands-on experience with advanced SQL, Python, and data processing tools.
   
   

Career Growth Opportunities

This position presents significant potential for career advancement, empowering team members to delve into new technologies and undertake challenging projects to foster their professional development.

Company Culture And Values

We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and innovative workplace culture, where team members are encouraged to share insights and contribute to projects. Our balanced hybrid work model cultivates a strong sense of community and inclusion.

Networking and Professional Opportunities

Joining our organization will provide you with unparalleled opportunities for networking and collaboration, enabling you to expand your professional connections and skillset in a supportive environment.

description:
Now accepting applicants for Focus Group studies. Earn up to $750 per week part-time working from home. Must register to see if you qualify. No Data Entry experience needed.

Data Entry Clerk Work From Home - Part Time Remote Focus Group Panelists

Our company is seeking individuals to participate in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Market Research assignments.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the option to participate remotely online or in-person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

Compensation


 * $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
 * $300-$750 (multi-session studies)
   
   

Job Requirements


 * Show up at least 10 mins before discussion start time.
 * Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
 * Complete written survey provided for each panel.
 * MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss PRIOR to meeting date.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Must have either a smartphone with working camera or desktop/laptop with webcam
 * Must have access to high speed internet connection
 * Desire to fully participate in one or several of the above topics
 * Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
 * Data entry clerk experience is not necessary.
   
   

Job Benefits


 * Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
 * No commute needed should you choose to work from home remotely.
 * No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
 * Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback of their products.
 * You get to review and use new products or services before they are released to the public.
   
   

You must apply on our website and complete a set of questionnaire to see if you qualify.

This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required. If you are a data entry clerk or someone just looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a passionate and skilled Data Engineer II to join our innovative technology team in a thriving FinTech environment. This remote position focuses on developing and enhancing cloud-based solutions that drive growth in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) sector. If you are excited about leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Python and Amazon Web Services (AWS), we encourage you to explore this opportunity.

Key Responsibilities


 * Design and implement data ingestion models, ETL processes, and testing protocols to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
 * Document data models and create entity-relationship diagrams.
 * Maintain and enhance our existing data architecture to support evolving business needs.
 * Develop and structure database schemas tailored for financial and real estate datasets.
 * Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including research, product, and operations, to improve analytical capabilities and streamline workflows.
 * Analyze extensive aggregated datasets encompassing various demographic, geographic, and GIS/spatial information.
 * Work collaboratively with both onshore and offshore team members across different time zones while ensuring effective communication.
 * Maintain a working overlap of 3-4 hours with the US West Coast to facilitate team discussions.
   
   

Required Skills


 * Proficiency in a scripting language, particularly Python.
 * Solid working knowledge of SQL, with the ability to craft complex queries for data manipulation and retrieval.
 * Strong interest in data organization alongside relational data structures.
 * Understanding of database design principles, optimization techniques, and data warehousing.
 * Familiarity with Amazon RDS, Redshift, NoSQL technologies (such as MongoDB) is advantageous.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline, or equivalent experience.
 * 2-4 years of programming experience in a scripting language, with a preference for Python.
 * Experience in database management, specifically with MySQL, SQL, or PostgreSQL.
 * Excellent problem-solving abilities, strong attention to detail, and effective communication skills.
 * Capacity to work independently within a fast-paced, Agile framework.
 * Enthusiasm for keeping updated on new cloud technologies, programming languages, and industry best practices.
 * Familiarity with financial concepts, mathematics, or GIS/spatial data, along with experience using Git, is a plus.
   
   

Career Growth Opportunities

Our commitment to professional development is paramount. We foster a collaborative environment where team members are encouraged to grow their skills and contribute meaningfully from day one. Joining our team means engaging in exciting projects that offer ample opportunities for career advancement.

Company Culture And Values

We pride ourselves on our diverse and inclusive workplace, where each team member can share unique perspectives and collaborate effectively. We celebrate our differences in gender, race, age, religion, ethnicity, identity, physical ability, and viewpoints, believing these variances enrich our insights and drive our success.

description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Description

Are you passionate about enabling teams to make data-driven decisions in the global connected services industry? Do you want to be at the forefront of unlocking the potential of data in our Connected Vehicle Platform? We are seeking a highly skilled data engineer with experience in AWS to join our team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in building and managing data pipelines, supporting real-time integrations, and ensuring the availability and reliability of our data. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement reporting and analytics features, while also proactively supporting product health through automation and scalability. Join us in our mission to empower our business users to make informed decisions with data.

Responsibilities


 * Build and document automated data pipelines from a wide range of data sources, with a strong focus on automation and scalability for our Connected Vehicle Platform.
 * Develop highly available data services to support near-real-time integrations with our Connected Vehicle Platform using a multi-cloud-based technology stack.
 * Ensure product and technical features are delivered to spec and on-time in a DevOps fashion through GitHub/GitHub Actions.
 * Contribute to overall architecture, framework, and design patterns to store and process high data volumes of connected vehicle data.
 * Develop solutions to measure, improve, and monitor data quality based on business requirements from connected vehicle data.
 * Collaborate with product owners, reporting analysts, data analysts, and business partners within an Agile/Scrum methodology to design and implement reporting and analytics features specifically tailored to the Connected Vehicle Platform.
 * Proactively support product health by building automated, scalable, and sustainable solutions, with a relentless focus on minimizing defects and technical issues.
 * Provide post-implementation production support for data pipelines, with a deep understanding of the unique challenges and requirements of the Connected Vehicle Platform.
   
   

Essential Skills


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, or a related field required.
 * 3+ years of experience in a data engineering role.
 * 2+ years of experience with AWS and related services (e.g., EC2, S3, SNS, Lambda, IAM).
 * Basic proficiency with a dialect of ANSI SQL and Python.
 * Knowledge of and experience with RDBMS platforms, such as MS SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres. NoSQL databases experience is a plus.
 * Experience with Snowflake Data Warehouses.
 * Experience in Data design and advanced Data Modeling in the Automotive industry.
 * Experience with ETL tools and techniques.
 * Experience with creating Kafka connectors, consumers, and processors.
 * Experience with participating in time-sensitive projects in a highly collaborative, multi-disciplinary team environment.
   
   

Additional Skills & Qualifications


 * Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field preferred.
 * AWS or GCP Certification is a plus.
   
   

Pay and Benefits

The pay range for this position is $40.00 - $64.00

Requirements

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following:


 * Medical, dental & vision
 * Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
 * 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
 * Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
 * Short and long-term disability
 * Health Spending Account (HSA)
 * Transportation benefits
 * Employee Assistance Program
 * Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
   
   

Workplace Type

This is a fully onsite position in Lewisville,TX.

Application Deadline

This position will be accepting applications until Jan 7, 2025.

About Actalent

Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Actalent, Diversity And Inclusion Are a Bridge Towards The Equity And Success Of Our People. DE&I Are Embedded Into Our Culture Through


 * Hiring diverse talent
 * Maintaining an inclusive environment through persistent self-reflection
 * Building a culture of care, engagement, and recognition with clear outcomes
 * Ensuring growth opportunities for our people
   
   

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.
title: Data Engineer

description:
About Capella Space

Capella Space stands at the forefront of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite technology and signal intelligence. We provide customers in governments, academia, and commercial sectors with reliable information that enables unparalleled understanding of the world. Our mission is centered on delivering timely and reliable Earth imagery, supporting diverse applications in defense & intelligence, disaster response, energy, environmental monitoring and more. Utilizing cutting-edge technology, Capella Space designs, manufactures and operates an advanced constellation of SAR imaging satellites. Our market-leading SAR satellites are complemented by an unmatched data infrastructure and automated ordering and delivery platform for fast, reliable insights where and when customers need it most.

What Makes Capella Unique?

Capella Space is a highly collaborative team environment, providing an opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the space industry, though no prior space experience is needed. We're looking for people excited about tackling seemingly impossible challenges, learning new skills and concepts, and helping each other achieve success. Our mission and our products are meant to understand the whole world and help everyone in it - regardless of race, creed, or any other distinction. We encourage you to bring your unique perspective to help make us stronger, including applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech.

Capella Space Internship Program

We are excited to offer a 10-week in-person internship at Capella Space, running from June 3rd to August 15th. This opportunity provides students with hands-on learning and valuable exposure to the dynamic fields of spacecraft design, manufacturing, and geospatial imagery. Alongside meaningful work, our internships include a variety of social events and experiences designed to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance throughout the summer. Stipends will be provided to support living costs throughout the program. Join us for a unique opportunity to grow professionally while engaging with a fast-paced and innovative industry.

About the Role and Team

The Capella Space Tasking & Scheduling team applies cutting-edge mathematical and optimization techniques to automate the planning, scheduling and commanding of a dynamic constellation of SAR satellites. As an intern on this team, you will be exposed to a diverse set of impactful and engaging technical problems that draw from principles in software engineering, physics, mathematics and optimization. This is a great opportunity for an undergraduate that is passionate for space, technology, computer programming and eager to learn software development best practices and solve complex technical problems.

Responsibilities


 * Design and implement a software feature, tool or solution that directly impacts Capella's tasking & scheduling operations
 * Collaborate with Tasking & Scheduling engineers to design, develop, and test software solutions
 * Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code
 * Research and apply software and engineering best practices
 * Extract and analyze data to measure the success of your solution
 * Participate in code reviews
 * Work and communicate effectively as part of a cross-functional team
 * Assist with documentation and technical support
 * Present your findings to technical and non-technical audiences
   
   

Requirements


 * Currently pursuing a degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Statistics, or a related field.
 * Familiarity with at least one programming language: Python (preferred), Java, C++, Matlab, Julia, R.
 * Basic knowledge of version control systems: (e.g., Git)
 * Ability to work independently and in a team environment
 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
 * Good communication and collaboration skills
 * Eagerness to learn new skills and technologies
   
   

Nice-to-Have


 * Data structures and algorithms coursework
 * Aerospace and navigation control coursework
 * Mathematical optimization: linear programming coursework
 * Data Science, Machine Learning, or Data Analytics coursework
   
   

Perks


 * Daily provided lunches and stocked kitchens has you covered at both office locations.
 * Swag! Work hard but look cool while doing it!
 * Events: Capella hosts social & educational events each month for all Capella employees, but also during the summer program for the entire intern class. 
 * Mentorship: each intern is paired with a mentor that supports & guides them through their time at Capella.
 * Furry friends? We've got you covered with dog-friendly work environment.
   
   

Compensation


 * This internship will be a 40-hour a week commitment at the pay of $37.00 per hour. An allowance will also be provided to support living costs throughout the program.
   
   

Equal Opportunity Statement

Capella Space is an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and upholding equitable hiring practices.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law, including those with a criminal history, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the CA Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. We actively encourage members of recognized minorities, women, Veterans, and those with disabilities to apply, and we work to create a welcoming and supportive environment for all applicants throughout the interview process. If you need assistance or require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify recruiting@capellaspace.com

To learn more about us, explore our site: https://www.capellaspace.com/ and follow us on X and LinkedIn to see our SAR imagery!
title: Tasking & Scheduling Intern

description:
Description

There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?

We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.

Key Responsibilities

The Business Analyst will link our information technology capacity and business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of our software product's features' analytical, building, testing, and deployment tasks. The primary goal is to contribute to the efficiency and effectiveness of our business operations by enhancing the quality of IT products and services, analyzing and designing business processes, and performing needs assessments in collaboration with the project team. This role demands an understanding of both the business and the technology to facilitate communication and enable the design of solutions that meet and exceed our business needs.

Business Process Analysis


 * Conduct in-depth analysis of existing business processes to identify efficiency gains and areas for improvement
 * Map out current and future state processes, providing a clear vision for potential enhancements
   
   

Data Analysis And Reporting


 * Gather and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, forecast outcomes, and support decision-making
 * Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor business performance
   
   

Requirements Gathering And Solution Development


 * Work closely with stakeholders to understand and translate business needs into detailed requirements
 * Design and propose business solutions that align with strategic objectives and improve operations
   
   

Project Management


 * Lead and manage projects from inception to completion, ensuring deliverables meet quality standards and business expectations
 * Monitor project progress, resolve issues, and make adjustments as necessary to stay on track
   
   

Stakeholder Communication And Presentation


 * Communicate effectively with team members, management, and external partners to align on business goals and initiatives
 * Prepare and deliver presentations that summarize findings and recommendations clearly and persuasively
   
   

Cross-Functional Collaboration


 * Facilitate collaboration between business units, technology, and support teams to ensure cohesive efforts and successful outcomes
 * Act as a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring mutual understanding and cooperation
   
   

Continuous Improvement


 * Proactively seek out opportunities for process optimization and innovation within the business
 * Implement best practices and stay abreast of industry trends to drive continuous improvement
   
   

United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!

Qualifications

What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):


 * Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field
 * 3+ years of related experience or successful completion of United DT Early Career Digital Leadership Program (ECDLP)
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
 * Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, Excel, Tableau)
 * Superb communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
 * Experience in project management and business process re-engineering
 * Ability to work independently and with others to resolve complex business issues
 * Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
 * Must be a team focused individual
 * Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
 * Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification
 * Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position
   
   

What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):


 * Master's degree
 * Airline experience
   
   

The base pay range for this role is $87,780.00 to $119,680.00.

The base salary range/hourly rate listed is dependent on job-related, non-discriminatory factors such as experience, education, and skills. This position is also eligible for bonus and/or long-term incentive compensation awards.

You may be eligible for the following competitive benefits: medical, dental, vision, life, accident & disability, parental leave, employee assistance program, commuter, paid holidays, paid time off, 401(k) and flight privileges.

United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law. Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions. Please contact JobAccommodations@united.com to request accommodation. HSC00000931

description:
Company Description

ProSidian is looking for “Great People Who Lead” at all levels in the organization. Are you a talented professional ready to deliver real value to clients in a fast-paced, challenging environment? ProSidian Consulting is looking for professionals who share our commitment to integrity, quality, and value.

ProSidian is a management and operations consulting firm with a reputation for its strong national practice spanning six solution areas including Risk Management, Energy & Sustainability, Compliance, Business Process, IT Effectiveness, and Talent Management. We help clients improve their operations.

Linking strategy to execution, ProSidian assists client leaders in maximizing company return on investment capital through design and execution of operations core to delivering value to customers. Visit www.ProSidian.com or follow the company on Twitter at www.twitter.com/prosidian for more information.

Job Description

ProSidian Seeks a Energy Systems Modeler | Data Analysis Support [DOEOP025015] - DPLH Est.: 665.6 Hrs. ST | 0 Hrs. OT on a Exempt 1099 Contract: No Overtime Pay Contract Contingent Basis Mid Atlantic | List Partner Company Labor Category - Content Subject Matter Expert/Instructor I Mid Level Professional aligned under services related to NAICS: 0 - DPLH Est.: 665.6 Hrs. ST | 0 Hrs. OT on a Exempt 1099 Contract: No Overtime Pay Contract Contingent Basis located CONUS - Washington DC Across The Mid Atlantic Region supporting a branch of DOE that leverages science and technology to address energy, environmental, and nuclear challenges, advancing climate and energy policies through strategic studies and policy analysis supporting analytical capabilities..

Seeking Energy Systems Modeler candidates with relevant Energy, Science, and Technology Research Sector Experience (functional and technical area expertise also ideal) to support professional services engagement for Energy, Science, and Technology Research Sector Clients such as DOEOP. This as a Contract Contingent or Contract W-2 (IRS-1099) Data Analysis Support Functional Area - Energy Technical Consulting Position; however, ProSidian reserves the right to convert to a Full-Time ProSidian employed W-2 Position.

Job Overview

Provide services and support as a Energy Technical Consulting (Energy Systems Modeler) in the Energy, Science, and Technology Research Industry Sector focussing on Business Process Solutions for clients such as Department of Energy (DOE | OP) | DOE Office of Policy (OP) Generally Located In CONUS - Washington DC and across the Mid Atlantic Region (Of Country/World).

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES - Energy Systems Modeler | Data Analysis Support [DOEOP025015]

Builds predictive models to evaluate energy systems and inform policy and operational decisions. Align with Data Analysis Support Functional Area initiatives as a Energy Systems Modeler that Conducts short and long-term data-driven analysis to evaluate energy systems, technology adoption, and market impacts.. Provide Public Comment Review, Data Analysis, Modeling, Evaluation, Mapping, Forecasting And Report Development, Data Tracking Tools, Workforce Policy Analysis And Convening, as well as Energy Market Economic And Regulatory Analysis Technical Consulting Services and support for The Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Policy (OP). These services enable mission objectives involved with renewable energy, fossil fuels, nuclear energy, hydrogen, biofuels, carbon capture, energy storage, grid modernization, energy efficiency, and sustainable infrastructure technologies.

Align with Data Analysis Support Functional Area initiatives as a Energy Systems Modeler that Conducts short and long-term data-driven analysis to evaluate energy systems, technology adoption, and market impacts. Provide Public Comment Review, Data Analysis, Modeling, Evaluation, Mapping, Forecasting And Report Development, Data Tracking Tools, Workforce Policy Analysis And Convening, as well as Energy Market Economic And Regulatory Analysis Technical Consulting Services and support for The Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Policy (OP). These services enable mission objectives involved with renewable energy, fossil fuels, nuclear energy, hydrogen, biofuels, carbon capture, energy storage, grid modernization, energy efficiency, and sustainable infrastructure technologies.

Energy Systems Modeler is responsible for key functions such as developing analyses, supporting initiatives, and ensuring alignment with project objectives. The role of Energy Systems Modeler involves supporting DOE initiatives with analysis, collaboration, and strategic implementation. Perform complex data aggregation, analysis, and visualization to inform energy policies and strategies. Perform complex data aggregation, analysis, and visualization to inform energy policies and strategies.

Qualifications

Desired Qualifications For Energy Systems Modeler | Data Analysis Support [DOEOP025015] (DOEOP025015) Candidates:

Qualified candidates for Energy Systems Modeler must possess expertise in their respective field, with experience in energy, policy, and technical consulting. Qualified candidates for Energy Systems Modeler must possess domain expertise, technical proficiency, and experience in related fields.

Education / Experience Requirements / Qualifications

Candidates for Energy Market Research Specialist typically require a Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., energy, environmental science, policy, or engineering) and a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience.

Skills Required

Key skills for Energy Market Research Specialist include analytical thinking, proficiency in data analysis tools, strong communication abilities, and subject matter expertise in energy and policy domains.


 * Standard Skills Required: Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools. | Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills for effective team management. | Outstanding time management and prioritization abilities to meet project milestones. | Adaptability to changing project requirements and priorities | Ability to multi-task and pay close attention to detail. | Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills | Strong communication skills, both oral and written.

We provide career opportunities spanning various disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build, and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients.

In addition, ProSidian may conduct drug testing for designated positions.
   
   

Competencies Required

Ancillary Details Of The Roles

Key ancillary responsibility for Energy Market Research Specialist includes contributing to the documentation and dissemination of energy solutions.

Other Details

The Energy Market Research Specialist role may involve cross-functional collaboration and participation in high-level DOE strategy discussions. Due to the sensitive nature of our work, the individuals who will be actively completing work on this contract or reviewing documents related to our operations must either be cleared (Secret Fcl / Top Secret Fcl) or be able to obtain and maintain a clearance (i.e. DOE Q).

title: Energy Systems Modeler | Data Analysis Support [DOEOP025015]

description:
This is a hybrid role.  The first three months are fulltime in the office. 



As a member of Eversource’s Advanced Modeling and Forecasting team, you will help to influence, to shape, and to optimize billions of dollars of grid investments over the next decade, ensuring our safe and effective transition into a clean energy future while providing highest standards of reliability and resiliency. The team strives for "best in class" data, analytics, and application practices, to help Eversource build the most advanced Distributed Energy Resources (DER) forecasting in the nation from the ground up.



As a Data Scientist, you will specialize in Distributed Energy Resources (DER) forecasting and power system impacts with a focus on emerging technologies (PV, EV, heat pumps). You will work with cross-functional teams to develop and implement advanced forecasting methodologies. By building a best-in-class electric distribution system analytics hub for actionable insights, you will drive strategic decision-making; around capital infrastructure investments, regulatory and rate case engagements, reliability and resiliency investments, and more. Your team members are other data scientists and engineers who develop forecast models for electric vehicles, heat pumps and other new load and generation resources to inform Eversource’s capital investments.




Essential Functions:

 * 
   Develop, use, maintain and manage models and solutions for forecasting long term load, solar and storage, building and transportation electrification
   
 * 
   Collect, preprocess, and analyze historical load and generation data to calibrate and validate forecasting models, ensuring accuracy and reliability across different DERs
   
 * 
   Monitor and evaluate performance of forecasting models and identify inconsistencies and improvements
   
 * 
   Conduct research and stay abreast of developments in emerging technologies, regulatory policies and best practices for modeling energy demand and generation
   
 * 
   Collaborate with cross functional teams, including engineers, data scientists, analysts, and energy efficiency experts to integrate advanced forecasting into system planning and operations
   
 * 
   Provide technical expertise and support internal stakeholders, external partners and customers on DER forecasting, power systems analysis, and renewable energy integration
   
 * 
   Clearly document advanced forecasting efforts and work with other departments to integrate new and existing processes
   
   
   
   
   
   

Technical Knowledge/Skill/Education/Licenses/Certifications:



Technical Knowledge/Skill: 

 * 
   Experience in forecasting with a focus on energy demand and DER applications
   
 * 
   Proficient programming skills in one or more languages (e.g. Python, Spark, SQL)
   
 * 
   Cloud architecture and tools, such as Microsoft Azure and Databricks
   
 * 
   Familiar with predictive analytics and statistical modeling techniques in the context of power systems, load forecasting, and renewable energy
   
 * 
   Familiar with distribution engineering and system planning processes
   
 * 
   Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work in a cross-functional environment
   
 * 
   Problem solving skills to analyze complex engineering data and draw actionable insights
   
   
   
   
   

Education:  

 * 
   BS in Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or related quantitative field.
   
 * 
   Masters preferred.
   
   
   
   
   

Experience:

 * 
   3+ years of related experience as a data scientist. Advanced/additional degrees will require fewer years of experience.
   
   
   
   
   

The ideal candidate will have experience with:                     

 * 
   Experience working with time series data, PI SCADA systems, DER management platforms and/or AMI (Advanced Metering Infrastructure)
   
 * 
   Geospatial tools, data and models (e.g. ArcGIS, Google Earth)
   
 * 
   Knowledge of regulatory frameworks, grid integration considerations related to DERs
   
 * 
   Experience in power systems engineering, energy modeling, or related fields
   
   
   
   
   
   

Compensation and Benefits:

Eversource offers a competitive total rewards program.  The annual salary range for this position is $94,940.00 to $105,490.00, plus incentive.  Salary is commensurate with your experience.  Check out the career site for an overview of our benefits. 




Working Conditions:

 * 
   Must be available to work emergency restoration assignment as required.
   
 * 
   Must be available to travel between MA/CT/NH as necessary.

Our company is seeking individuals to participate in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Market Research assignments.

A Bit About Us

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Senior BI Analyst to join our dynamic team in the healthcare industry. This role is for those who are passionate about leveraging data-driven insights to drive business improvement and optimize performance. The Senior BI Analyst will be involved in strategic projects and will collaborate with various teams across the organization. They will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining BI solutions that will provide the data necessary for strategic decision-making.



Why join us?



 * Medical, Dental, Vision
 * Annual performance bonus
 * Work from home flexibility
 * 401k with company match
 * Flexible work schedule
   
   

Job Details

Responsibilities


 * Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Dashboards, Power BI, Data Management, ETL, Tableau, Python, SQL, Data reporting, SAP HANA.
 * Analyze complex data sets and convert them into information that can help drive decision making.
 * Collaborate with various teams across the organization to identify opportunities for process improvement.
 * Design and create data reports using various reporting tools to help the business make informed decisions.
 * Monitor data quality, identify data inconsistencies, and work on data cleansing.
 * Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI and Tableau.
 * Ensure the data security and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
 * Train end-users on new reports and dashboards.
 * Provide technical leadership to the team and guide them in resolving complex data issues.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

 * Strong experience in Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Dashboards, Power BI, Data Management, ETL, Tableau, Python, SQL, Data reporting, SAP HANA.

description:
Job Summary

Value-Based Care (VBC) Analytics is an independent organization covering Baylor Scott & White Health Plan (Payer) and Baylor Scott & White Quality Alliance (Accountable Care Organization) analytical and data science needs.

We are seeking a customer-facing Healthcare Data Scientist who will be responsible for delivering solutions that help our organization's value-based care initiatives. The ideal candidate will leverage data science and other advanced analytical techniques to support improvement of patient outcomes, enhance care quality, mitigate risks, and reduce costs. The role will require an analytical mindset and experience effectively communicating data insights and methodologies to a non-technical audience.

SALARY: The pay range for this position is $41.97/hour ($87,297.60/year) for those with entry-level qualifications up to $72.62/hour ($151,049/year) for those highly experienced. The specific rate will depend upon the successful candidate's specific qualifications and prior experience.

Essential Functions Of The Role


 * [25%] Communication and Consulting: Summarize and effectively communicate complex data science concepts to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt action from non-technical audience from data-driven recommendations.
 * [25%] Applied Machine Learning: Implement machine learning solutions within production environments at scale. Apply a variety of machine learning techniques to increase the quality of care and outcomes, and other key metrics.
 * [20%] Data Collection and Optimization: Collect and analyze data from a variety of SQL environments (Snowflake, SQL Server) and other data sources, including electronic health records, and claims data.
 * [20%] Analyze Healthcare Data: Conduct detailed analyses on complex healthcare datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support value-based care initiatives.
 * [10%] Stay Informed: Stay up to date on the latest advancements in data science and healthcare analytics to continuously improve our methodologies and tools.
   
   

KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

The ideal candidate will have some of the following skills and an eagerness to learn the rest:


 * Education: Bachelor's or advanced degree in mathematics, statistics, data science, or another quantitative field.
 * Effective Communication: Experienced in communicating findings and recommendations directly to Executive-level customers and healthcare professionals
 * Healthcare Knowledge: Understanding of various healthcare data sources such as medical/pharmacy claims, social determinants of health (SDOH) and electronic health records.
 * Analytical Skills: Academic or professional experience conducting analytics and experimentation using algorithms associated with advanced analytics topics, including binary classification algorithms, regression algorithms, Neural Network frameworks, Natural Language Processing, etc.
 * Technical Skills: Proficiency in common language / tools for AI/ML such as Python, PySpark or R. Understanding of software engineering topics, including version control, CI/CD, and unit tests
 * Problem Solving: A passion for solving puzzles and digging into data
 * Technology Stack: Familiarity with deploying data science products at scale in a cloud environment such as Snowflake, Databricks or Azure AI/ML Studio.
   
   

Benefits

Our competitive benefits package includes the following


 * Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits
 * 401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%
 * Tuition Reimbursement
 * PTO accrual beginning Day 1
   
   

Note: Benefits may vary based on position type and/or level

Qualifications


 * EDUCATION - Masters' or Bachelors plus 2 years of work experience above the minimum qualification
 * EXPERIENCE - 3 Years of Experience

Job Description

Job Description

Salary: $70,000-100,000

Position: Financial & Data Analyst

Job Type: W-2 (Full time)

Location: Remote, but must live in FL, MN, or TX

Compensation: Salary, Bonus, and Benefits

Company Overview

Phoenix Loss Control (Phoenix orPLC) is abusiness servicesproviderin the cable, telecom, and utilities sector. PLCs core service is outside plant damage investigation, recovery, and prevention. We help our clients recover the costs of third-partydamageto their infrastructure, such asunderground fiber optic or gas lines. PLC currently employs over 120people, servicing some of the largest cableandtelecomsoperatorsacross the country(Comcast,Spectrum,AT&T, and Google, to name a few).Phoenix is currently aggressively expanding its business and looking for talented and energetic people to bring onboard to help drive growth.

Position Summary

Phoenix Loss Control is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Financial and Data Analyst to join our team. As a Financial and Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting financial and operational data to provide valuable insights and support decision-making processes within the company. Additionally, you will work closely with our outside plant damage recovery team to optimize operations and drive efficiency in our recovery processes.

This position is exclusively available to residents of MN, TX, or FL.

Duties


 * Collect and analyze financial and operational data to track performance and identify trends
 * Prepare KPI and financial reports, forecasts, and budgets to support strategic decision-making
 * Develop and maintain models to guide business planning and strategy
 * Collaborate with the outside plant damage recovery team to optimize recovery processes
 * Identify opportunities for cost reduction and revenue enhancement through data analysis
 * Work with the engineering team to build out reporting functionality in our proprietary database
 * Present findings and recommendations to senior management to drive business improvement initiatives
   
   

Required Skills And Capabilities


 * Bachelor's degree (preference for Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field)
 * At least 2 years of work experience as a Financial or Operations Analyst (or in a related role)
 * Expert Excel skills, including advanced functions, pivot tables, and data analysis tools
 * Proficiency in financial modeling and data visualization tools
 * Background and experience in Power BI required
 * Strong attention to detail and excellent analytical skills
 * Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills
 * Personal computer and high-speed internet access

description:
Our mission is to create the Experience of a Lifetime for our employees, so they can, in turn, create the Experience of a Lifetime for our guests. We own and operate the most renowned destination resorts in the world as well as regional and local ski areas outside major cities, and connect them all through one unrivaled network. We are looking for ambitious leaders, innovators and creators to join our talented team. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you!

Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

About This Role 

We are looking for a passionate and driven Senior Data Engineer to become an important part of our fast-paced, high-energy, and innovative culture. The ideal candidate will have experience in Azure, Databricks, ETL processes, Python, SQL, Jira and Github. In addition to these skills, the candidate should also have experience in data lake house architecture, data modeling and migration from on-premise enterprise data warehousing to data lake. 

 

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data pipelines that are scalable, reliable, and efficient. You will work closely with analytics teams, data scientist and other stakeholders to understand their requirements and architect and implement data solutions that meet their needs.

 

Responsibilities  


 * Design, develop and maintain data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data into our data lake (e.g., Azure Data Lake Storage, AWS S3)
 * Integrate with external APIs and services (e.g., RESTful APIs) to exchange data and trigger actions
 * Design and Develop data APIs and API Management layer
 * Experience orchestrating and monitoring workflows
 * Work with data scientists/data analysts to understand their requirements and design solutions that meet their needs 
 * Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data processing tasks
 * Write complex SQL queries
 * Optimize database performance by tuning queries and indexes
 * Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle
 * Enable versioning, logging and monitoring for platform and application observability
 * Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data pipelines and Azure DevOps integrations
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., data engineers, data scientists, product managers) to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
 * Contribute to the development and improvement of CI/CD pipelines (e.g., using Jenkins, Azure DevOps, GitLab CI)
 * Implement and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform or Ansible
 * Participate in code reviews and contribute to the improvement of development processes
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and best practices in event-driven architectures and data processing
 * Mentor and guide junior team members
   
   

 

Qualifications 


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field 
 * 5+ years of experience in data engineering
 * Experience with Azure and Databricks
 * Strong knowledge of ETL processes  
 * Proficiency in configuration languages (Terraform, YAML)
 * Experience with API integration and RESTful services
 * Proficiency in Python, SQL, Jira and Github  
 * Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka is a plus 
 * Experience with Jira and Github 
 * Experience in data lake house architecture
 * Experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
 * Experience ingesting data from Event Hubs 
 * Experience in data modeling 
 * Experience in migration from on-premise enterprise data warehousing to data lake
 * Familiarity with data quality and validation tools
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Excellent communication and collaboration skills
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team
   
   

The expected Total Compensation for this role is $140,000 + annual bonus. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

Job Benefits


 * Ski/Mountain Perks! Free passes for employees, employee discounted lift tickets for friends and family AND free ski lessons
 * MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, and mountain shuttles
 * 401(k) Retirement Plan
 * Employee Assistance Program
 * Excellent training and professional development
   
   

Full Time Roles Are Eligible For The Above, Plus


 * Health Insurance; Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, and Vision Insurance plans (for eligible seasonal employees after working 500 hours)
 * Free ski passes for dependents
 * Critical Illness and Accident plans
   
   

Vail Resorts offers a ‘Hybrid’ work environment where employees living within 50 miles of the Broomfield office work on-site Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and have flexibility to work off-site on Mondays and Fridays. Employees living outside of a commutable distance can work remotely from British Columbia, Washington D.C., and the 16 U.S. states* in which we currently operate. This includes: California, Colorado, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Utah, Vermont, Washington State, Wisconsin, and Wyoming.

Please note that the ability to work in person or off-site, and the particulars related to such work, are subject to change at any time; and, accordingly, the Company reserves the right to change its policies and/or require in-person/in-office work or off-site work at any time in its sole discretion.

In completing this application, and when submitting related documentation, applicants may redact information that identifies their age, date of birth, and/or dates of attendance at or graduation from an educational institution.

Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.

 * No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
 * Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback of their products.
 * You get to review and use new products or services before they are released to the public.
   
   

You must apply on our website and complete a set of questionnaire to see if you qualify.

This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required. If you are a data entry clerk or someone just looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.
title: Remote Part-Time Focus Group Participants (Up To $750/Week)

description:
Job Responsibilities

Careers at DPH: Work that makes a difference!

Embracing Service, Inspiring Innovation, Promoting Teamwork, Pursuing Excellence, and Advancing Equity

This position is located in the Bureau of Communicable Disease Prevention and Control's Communicable Disease Epidemiology Section.

Assesses, recommends and implements statistical methods to analyze COVID-19 data and other large data sets for disease surveillance to meet Agency grant and general decision-making requirements.

Implements Communicable Disease Epidemiology Section (CDES) data analytics modernization activities related to predictive modeling and disease forecasting to inform public health action. Collaborates with team to identify, incorporate and evaluate data from disparate sources to enhance predictive model building.

Applies strong analytic and problem-solving skills to data processing (cleaning, validating, improving, linking, automating) while adhering to all security and confidentiality policies for protected health information.

Monitors data to identify trends, strengths and limitations of current processes or knowledge. Documents all procedures as needed.

Translates data insights into knowledge (presentations, reports, dashboards) for internal use to support internal decision making and for external use to support population behavior change. Participates in the training of others in the Bureau.

Minimum And Additional Requirements

State Minimum Requirements: A master's degree in biostatistics, computational epidemiology or closely related field and relevant working experience. A doctoral degree in biostatistics or computational epidemiology related to the spread of infectious diseases may substitute for experience.

Institutions of Higher Learning must be recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation.

Agency Additional Requirements: Applicants indicating college credit or degree(s) on the application may upload an unofficial copy of the transcript as an attachment to the application. Please note that the agency will require an official, certified copy of the transcript or diploma prior to hiring.

Additional Comments

DRIVING RECORD: If this position requires the applicant to possess a valid driver’s license to operate a state vehicle or personal vehicle, any applicant being considered in the final stages of selection for the position will be required to provide a certified copy of a 10-year driving record.

SC DPH is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employing agency. We are committed to a diverse workforce. SC DPH does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age (40 or older), disability or genetic information.

The South Carolina Department of Public Health offers an exceptional benefits package for temporary grant positions that includes:


 * Health, Dental, Vision, Long Term Disability, and Life Insurance for Primary Member, Spouse, and Children (must average at least 30 hours a week to be eligible)
 * 15 days annual (vacation) leave per year
 * 15 days sick leave per year
 * 13 paid holidays
 * State Retirement Plan and Deferred Compensation Programs
 * REMOTE WORK: The option to work partially remote may be available after six (6) months of employment for approved positions
title: Senior Consultant – Data Analytics

description:
Job Overview

We are actively seeking a dedicated and proficient Python Instructor to conduct dynamic virtual training sessions focusing on Data Analysis. This role is crucial to our mission of enhancing digital engineering capabilities within our workforce by imparting essential data analytics skills through the Python programming environment.

Key Responsibilities


 * Deliver engaging and interactive training courses tailored to equip participants with the foundational skills necessary for programming and data manipulation.
 * Guide employees in effectively managing tabular datasets and employing various techniques for data exploration, including handling missing values and performing time series analysis.
 * Instruct on accessing data from diverse sources and interfacing with databases to streamline data analysis processes.
 * Ensure the preparedness of all training materials, which must be provided at least five business days prior to the scheduled sessions.
 * Facilitate a minimum of four days of comprehensive training, accommodating up to 20 participants per session, and foster an environment for questions and discussions.
 * Compile and submit a roster sheet to the organization following course completion to track participant engagement.
   
   

Required Skills


 * Strong proficiency in Python programming and its application to data analysis.
 * Familiarity with key data analysis libraries, including NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Pandas.
 * Understanding of machine learning basics using Scikit-learn.
 * Excellent communication and instructional skills, with the ability to deliver compelling training sessions.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Proven experience in both data analysis and teaching.
 * Capacity to conduct virtual training sessions effectively, ensuring participant engagement.
 * Exceptional organizational skills and a strong aptitude for instructional design.
   
   

Career Growth Opportunities

This role offers instructors the chance to enhance their virtual teaching skills while contributing significantly to the development of data analytics expertise within the workforce. Joining our team means stepping into a role that encourages continuous professional development and skill enhancement within a growing field.

Company Culture And Values

Our organization prides itself on fostering a culture that values continuous learning, innovation, and professional development. We are committed to enhancing the digital skills of our workforce, ensuring that our team members are equipped to thrive in an ever-evolving technological landscape.

Employment Type: Full-Time
title: Remote Instructor for Python Data Analysis | Virtual

Description of Work Unit

The Department of Clinical Sciences mission is to assure the health and productivity of animals to meet societal needs through high quality educational programs for professional veterinary medical students, graduate veterinarians, and the public through a faculty and veterinary medical center of excellence, and to advance and disseminate comparative biomedical knowledge in an environment of interdisciplinary collaboration.

Search Contact Emailcvmbs-clinsci_hr@Mail.Colostate.edu
